title: PRIVATE POOL
body:
Summary: tony got you a pool

Pairing: tony stark x reader

Word count: 1680

Warnings: hinting sexual themes, explicit language.

It had been almost a full week since the final construction of the indoor pool had taken place and it was now fully installed and filled with water to the brim. More than any of the other Avengers, you had been taking laps for exercise while the others preferred the gym for their workouts. You did not mind, and even though Tony had paid only heaven knows how much for the renovation that had been taken place for a few weeks now, he did not seem to mind neither. Really, he was just happy you were enjoying what you had been needing for so long.

You had mentioned more than once how difficult it was to exercise and uphold the unique skill set you had obtained through your former position in the Frogman Corps back, as an immense part of the training you had undergone while serving your country dealt with water. Now, with being an Avenger, jumping into the ocean to do breath stabilization training exercises was no longer an option. Tony seemed more than keen to provide you with this one thing, as you did not take up much space prior to this.

Truth be told, you were not the most valuable asset to the team. You could not fly, neither could you crawl on buildings nor swing from skyscraper to another. Neither were you the only team member who had undergone standard military training, however, when it came to eliminating the threat before it could cause damage, you were the pearl on the team. No one liked a blow in the back when fighting off bad guys, so that’s when they appreciated you lying on a rooftop or a creek, taking them down from your hiding one after one, completely unnoticed.

You had gotten impeccable aim from your father who had brought you along on his hunting trips when you were the innocent age of 8 and decided to join the military and over the course of 13 years, you became the best sniper in the Royal Army. Along with friends meant to last a lifetime, you received several medals over time and were soon decorated in ribbon and medallions. The threat, of course, grew aware of the upper hand with such a good shot, and the first bounty on your head surfaced only four years into your service at an amount of 70K.

Enemies were then aware of your name and knew it to be feared, for providing excellent service for your country you were protected as any other military personnel, and the only chances that were taken on claiming that bounty were the failed attempts of dying men. For many years you watched more and more excellent marksmen and sharpshooters conduct superior work, and the prize on your head went up to roughly 900K dollars. That was when you decided it was time to move on and after a series of tough nine months, you were in the special force of the Frogman Corps.

And that was how you found your way into a portion of recommendation letters from the executive committee; with high acclaim scripted by one and only Thaddeus Ross. Even though the Avengers officially had no say in the matter of who to recruit for the team, all papers went by the office in the New Avengers Facility and James Rhodes seemed much delighted you had a future with the Avengers. 

As the aftermath of a couple of meetings, scheduled appointments to show off your techniques – really just for the fun of it for Tony – you found yourself with an offer impossible to decline.

You operated with the Avengers and fought to take down H.A.M.M.E.R. The temporary alignment was not meant to stand longer than needed, but Tony Stark was utterly impressed with your contribution and wanted you to join forces after your stunning performance. Things had been running quietly, heading on missions rarely as the accords estranged the name of the Avengers. Tony had warned you he was not the one pulling the strings and the team merely got deployed when most necessary, so other than the infrequent battles thriving on absolute chaos, the Avengers facility was composed.

Even though the standard military training you had undergone gave you a significant advantage when fighting bad guys, your skills became most useful when it came to knowledge of marine machinery and pretty much all missions carried out underwater. On the contrary to what one might think, now the team had you, it was hard for them to apprehend how the had carried on for this long without you.

Although you had been with the Avengers for almost a year, Tony was afraid you were not feeling home yet, as when not on assigned missions kicking ass from underwater, your only role was cooking up a delicious meal every now and then.

When Tony set foot in the sturdy, huge room he was instantly calmed by tranquil waves in the water and quiet sounds of occasional, low splashes. Taking notice of your wavy figure in the water, he smiled to himself and walked around the pool to meet you at the end.

You resurfaced and sucked in a deep, long breath, relishing the air filling your lungs. When opening your eyes, you blinked the water from the lashes and smiled delighted up at Tony, and rested your arms on the brim.

“Glad to see you’re enjoying the pool,” he said, voice resounding as it bounced off the walls. “You’re hiding an awful lot down here.”

"Just exercising.”

“That and developing gills,” he quipped and crouched down in front of you.

“Well, it is a very nice pool. Almost too much space for just me,” you appreciated and back a tad away from the brim to get a better look at him.

He shrugged and clicked his tongue as you watched his reflecting eyes. “It was just a minor instalment.”

“Well, I’m very thankful,” you grinned at his humble statement and shook your head. “Why don’t you join me?”

He pulled a face. “Me? No.”

“What? Why not?”

“I… am not dressed for it?” he spoke as if he had come up with a valid excuse. You figured from the way his words came uncertain, he was convincing himself more than you.

“Dressed?” you chuckled and splashed some water around, as you kept yourself up with your arms. “No need for that. You got out of your way to install a damn pool, at least try it out,” you pleaded and tilted your head, the playing smirk still curling your lip to a point it made Tony hard. Good thing he was crouching, so the bulge was not as visible.

He was already convinced, but the look on your face was something he did not want to see fade. “I’ll look away.”

Tony laughed aloud. As if there was any need for that. When he stood up with his eyes still fixated, you grinned and swam further back, turning when you saw his hands got for the neck of his shirt.

It was not long until you heard a light splash and you turned back around, circling him with no worry.

“Don’t–don’t do that, I’m getting nauseous.”

“Shut up,” you chuckled and got a tad closer. “It’s nice, don’t you think?”

“I’m really not much of a swimmer, but yeah. Sure. Can you touch the bottom?” asked Tony, not sure if it was too deep.

“Yeah.” He made an “oh” sound and you grinned at him, swimming closer. It was no lie, Tony was not the tallest of tall and if you were not wrong, he did not appreciate always having to look up to other people. However, in your opinion he seemed just the perfect size, knowing if you were gonna make your move on him at some point, he was not the kind you would have to stand on toes to reach. You were perfectly fine with that. “You’re just not very big. It’s fine, it’s not your fault.”

He chuckled, “you’d be surprised.”

“Oh, yeah?”

“Mhm…” he hummed, eyes appreciating the way your figure moved in the water.

“Knew the big ego had to come from somewhere,” you pronounced your thoughts. 

“You’re a little overdressed, don’t you think?” he wheedled and gave you a look. “Not really a one-piece guy.”

You tilted your head and parted your lips. “Do you want me to go change for you?”

Smacking his lips, he squinted his eye for a second as if contemplating the thought. “Nah, just–I guess you could just lose it, we’ll probably be fine, probably.”

Positioned in front of him, you allowed yourself to take him in for a closer look. “You’re gonna help me rid myself of it, then?”

Your lips brushed just passed his soft ones, and he took you by surprise when snaking his arm around your waist, pulling you in close. Your lips parted to react but you immediately retracted any words before they could leave, astounded at his girth. “Are we gonna keep this up? ‘Cause I’ve actually been waiting around for you. Besides, foreplay really isn’t my style.”

“It seems to affect you more than you care to admit.”

“Don’t fool yourself, dear,” he taunted, feeling upper-handed and proud with himself. For Tony Stark to have use of the incredible confidence he possessed took no effort, only when with you, he seemed to feel modest when looking to you. Though his respect was something most people were offered out of simple politeness, it took some to gain his trust. He had seen you having his back both on the field of work and in the public eye when making a good appearance of the Avengers. You were the kind of women he trusted his life with.

“Am I?” you whispered, your tone laced with a seductive timbre and the empowered force Tony witnessed quickly disappeared when you grabbed hold of his hard. With his mouth slightly agape, your eyes bored directly into his as you felt his length twitch.

Things had been running quietly, heading on missions rarely as the accords estranged the name of the Avengers. Tony had warned you he was not the one pulling the strings and the team merely got deployed when most necessary, so other than the infrequent battles thriving on absolute chaos, the Avengers facility was composed.

Even though the standard military training you had undergone gave you a significant advantage when fighting bad guys, your skills became most useful when it came to knowledge of marine machinery and pretty much all missions carried out underwater. On the contrary to what one might think, now the team had you, it was hard for them to apprehend how the had carried on for this long without you.

Although you had been with the Avengers for almost a year, Tony was afraid you were not feeling home yet, as when not on assigned missions kicking ass from underwater, your only role was cooking up a delicious meal every now and then.

When Tony set foot in the sturdy, huge room he was instantly calmed by tranquil waves in the water and quiet sounds of occasional, low splashes. Taking notice of your wavy figure in the water, he smiled to himself and walked around the pool to meet you at the end.

You resurfaced and sucked in a deep, long breath, relishing the air filling your lungs. When opening your eyes, you blinked the water from the lashes and smiled delighted up at Tony, and rested your arms on the brim.

“Glad to see you’re enjoying the pool,” he said, voice resounding as it bounced off the walls. “You’re hiding an awful lot down here.”

"Just exercising.”

“That and developing gills,” he quipped and crouched down in front of you.

“Well, it is a very nice pool. Almost too much space for just me,” you appreciated and back a tad away from the brim to get a better look at him.

He shrugged and clicked his tongue as you watched his reflecting eyes. “It was just a minor instalment.”

“Well, I’m very thankful,” you grinned at his humble statement and shook your head. “Why don’t you join me?”

He pulled a face. “Me? No.”

“What? Why not?”

“I… am not dressed for it?” he spoke as if he had come up with a valid excuse. You figured from the way his words came uncertain, he was convincing himself more than you.

“Dressed?” you chuckled and splashed some water around, as you kept yourself up with your arms. “No need for that. You got out of your way to install a damn pool, at least try it out,” you pleaded and tilted your head, the playing smirk still curling your lip to a point it made Tony hard. Good thing he was crouching, so the bulge was not as visible.

He was already convinced, but the look on your face was something he did not want to see fade. “I’ll look away.”

Tony laughed aloud. As if there was any need for that. When he stood up with his eyes still fixated, you grinned and swam further back, turning when you saw his hands got for the neck of his shirt.

It was not long until you heard a light splash and you turned back around, circling him with no worry.

“Don’t–don’t do that, I’m getting nauseous.”

“Shut up,” you chuckled and got a tad closer. “It’s nice, don’t you think?”

“I’m really not much of a swimmer, but yeah. Sure. Can you touch the bottom?” asked Tony, not sure if it was too deep.

“Yeah.” He made an “oh” sound and you grinned at him, swimming closer. It was no lie, Tony was not the tallest of tall and if you were not wrong, he did not appreciate always having to look up to other people. However, in your opinion he seemed just the perfect size, knowing if you were gonna make your move on him at some point, he was not the kind you would have to stand on toes to reach. You were perfectly fine with that. “You’re just not very big. It’s fine, it’s not your fault.”

He chuckled, “you’d be surprised.”

“Oh, yeah?”

“Mhm…” he hummed, eyes appreciating the way your figure moved in the water.

“Knew the big ego had to come from somewhere,” you pronounced your thoughts. 

“You’re a little overdressed, don’t you think?” he wheedled and gave you a look. “Not really a one-piece guy.”

You tilted your head and parted your lips. “Do you want me to go change for you?”

Smacking his lips, he squinted his eye for a second as if contemplating the thought. “Nah, just–I guess you could just lose it, we’ll probably be fine, probably.”

Positioned in front of him, you allowed yourself to take him in for a closer look. “You’re gonna help me rid myself of it, then?”

Your lips brushed just passed his soft ones, and he took you by surprise when snaking his arm around your waist, pulling you in close. Your lips parted to react but you immediately retracted any words before they could leave, astounded at his girth. “Are we gonna keep this up? ‘Cause I’ve actually been waiting around for you. Besides, foreplay really isn’t my style.”

“It seems to affect you more than you care to admit.”

“Don’t fool yourself, dear,” he taunted, feeling upper-handed and proud with himself. For Tony Stark to have use of the incredible confidence he possessed took no effort, only when with you, he seemed to feel modest when looking to you. Though his respect was something most people were offered out of simple politeness, it took some to gain his trust. He had seen you having his back both on the field of work and in the public eye when making a good appearance of the Avengers. You were the kind of women he trusted his life with.

“Am I?” you whispered, your tone laced with a seductive timbre and the empowered force Tony witnessed quickly disappeared when you grabbed hold of his hard. With his mouth slightly agape, your eyes bored directly into his as you felt his length twitch.

Summary: tony got you a pool

Pairing: tony stark x reader

Word count: 1680

Warnings: hinting sexual themes, explicit language.

It had been almost a full week since the final construction of the indoor pool had taken place and it was now fully installed and filled with water to the brim. More than any of the other Avengers, you had been taking laps for exercise while the others preferred the gym for their workouts. You did not mind, and even though Tony had paid only heaven knows how much for the renovation that had been taken place for a few weeks now, he did not seem to mind neither. Really, he was just happy you were enjoying what you had been needing for so long.

title: Reach Across the Stars. Part 4
body:
Links to part 1 (masterlist), part 3

This is it for this story. There’s a kind of a time jump thing that this chapter does, I hope it makes sense.  Not sure I’m happy with the way it turned out but… well, I’ll let you, guys, decide about its merits. 

Tagging @dixiehellcat @elphierix @jess-b-thot

Chapter 4

–“I love you, I’m lucky.”–

 

She sits cross-legged on the floor of the space pod behind the backs of the crew seats, propped uncomfortably against the bulkhead.  Tries not to think about how alluring, how prohibitively soft and cozy they appear from her current position. It’s pointless to indulge in such thoughts – she won’t be moving from where she is now any time soon.  Because where she is now is the only place wide enough in this cramped little pod where she could sit down with Tony cradled securely in her armored embrace, and she is not about to allow herself to be parted from him. Not after everything. Not anymore.

She had retracted the armor the moment they settled down, gently tightening her hold on Tony when his unconscious form slipped further into her embrace once the additional bulk of the armor was gone.  She needed to touch him, to feel him solid and alive against her skin.  But he feels so cold, so cold.  

She hoists him up higher in her lap, trying to be as gentle as she possibly can, terrified that she would hurt him, would break him somehow.  Because he looks so fragile, so thin – ethereal almost, like he could disappear at any moment, could crumble to stardust in her arms.  

The thought makes her shiver, and she cocoons her body around him as if to shield him from the universe itself, to give him as much of her warmth as she can, ignoring the way her back twinges in protest.  

He still feels cold.

–“…lucky.”–

She thought they were too late.  When they stepped inside that spaceship – that cold, airless tomb, a black void of death amidst the apathetic, starry beauty of the cosmos, she thought they were too late.

And then she saw him – ghostly pale and lifeless, slumped ragdoll-like against a blue-skinned one-eyed woman, and she became convinced that they were.

But then the woman moved, sensing their approach, shifted as though to protect him, and a new rush of hope made Pepper’s knees go weak.

“His oxygen is almost out,” the woman rasped, when Pepper dropped down beside him, retracting her gauntlets and helmet despite the urgent flash of warning on the HUD.  

She could handle a few moments without oxygen.  She wanted to see with her own eyes the feeble rise and fall of his chest.  She wanted to touch his face.   She wanted… she needed… she…

“You need to hurry.”

Yes, that.

 

Gingerly she slipped her arms under Tony, pulling him in, pulling him up with her.  Moved to rush back toward the pod.

“My team?” Rocket’s sudden, desperation tinged growl stopped her in her tracks.

Oh no…

 

She watched the woman stumble weakly to her feet, one hand braced on the bulkhead.  Watched her shake her head with an expression of muted regret. “Dust,” she said, her voice as hollow as the look in her eye.  Then her expression twisted, morphing into something uglier, something deadly.  “Except Gamora.  He killed Gamora.”

The raccoon stiffened, eyes wide, mouth opening and closing in quick, convulsive bursts. And then sound burst through – an awful keening noise that echoed through the empty bowels of the ship like a death knell, making the darkness slither in closer, its icy breath seeming to filter past the suit’s defenses, making her shiver.

“Rocket,” she begged, forcing herself not to flinch away from him as he turned his grief-blackened eyes toward her, his little body trembling with the force of emotions that she understood all too well.  “Please, we gotta go. Let’s go.”

“We need to get the Terran home,” the blue-skinned woman broke in, impassive, startling them both, and Pepper watched in growing apprehension as the woman staggered a few steps to the nearby console to pick up an all-too-familiar helmet before addressing them both again in the same robotic tone. “He’s key to bringing everyone else back.”

Something about her words, something about the way she said it made Pepper tug Tony even closer to her chest, fighting the urge to run away from them both.

Rocket’s gaze snapped to her then, drawn by her involuntary movement, black eyes narrowing on Tony’s limp form cocooned in her armored grasp, the furry face twisting into an ugly resentful sneer.  “Lucky you,” he spat out, raising his gaze toward her.  “Lucky you.”  

–“…lucky.”–

She feels a shudder run through him, his gaunt chest spasming as if he’s suddenly running out of air, and she checks the gauge frantically, checks his mask.  But it’s not that, it’s not that.  And when she sees the way his eyes move behind closed lids, the way his face twists even in the unconsciousness that passes for sleep, she understands.

Carefully, she unwraps one arm from around his chest, moves it to run gentle fingers through his hair, matted with sweat and dried blood.

“Hush,” she shushes him, leaning in to place a quick kiss on the too-too cold skin of his brow. Ghosts her fingertips over the haggard hollow of his cheek.  “You’re safe now, you’ll be okay.  It’ll all be okay.”

She keeps up her mantra, whispering the soothing empty promises in his ear until he calms, the lines of his face softening, smoothing out, his breathing relaxing once more.  She lets herself relax, too, then.  Lets her forehead thump lightly against his, exhaling a soft sigh of relief, and almost allows herself to believe her own words.

Later, when they are back on Earth, she will sit at his bedside in the partially restored medical wing, watching him slowly get stronger, and she will think about the message he left her when he feared that he would never see her again, will think about how close that fear came to be, how close she came to losing him this time, how she might lose him still when all is said and done, when he gets strong enough to do what everyone expects of him to make things right.  

Later, when they are back at home, and a nightmare rips him out of his uneasy sleep and he jackknifes in bed beside her, a gasping scream echoing between the empty walls of their bedroom, his still too thin chest heaving with the force of it, she will wrap her arms around his trembling form, unafraid of the way he startles within her grasp, his body growing tense like a string about to snap.  And she will hold him, whispering softly to him until that snap-ready tension begins to leach away, until the awful blackness in the unseeing pools of his eyes fades and he blinks, slowly, laboriously, coming back into the present.  Until he crumples, sagging bonelessly into her embrace.  And she will hold him, as tight as she dares, as he trembles against her, his body wracked by silent agonizing sobs.  Hold him until he falls back into the exhausted sleep, his face still tucked against the side of her neck.  And only then will she notice that she is crying, too, her own tears making new tracks on her skin where his have just begun to dry.  And she will wonder, as she watches his uneasy repose, her own sleep now refusing to come, if he will ever truly come back to her, if part of him will be forever lost somewhere amid that cold macabre beauty of space.

But for now as she watches him settle trustingly in her arms, watches his chest rise and fall at a steady reassuring rhythm, she thinks back to Rocket’s anguished reproach and she selfishly finds herself agreeing with the raccoon.

“I love you,” she whispers, pressing another gentle kiss over the fading scar on his cheek.  “I’m lucky.”

FIN

–“…lucky.”–

Later, when they are back at home, and a nightmare rips him out of his uneasy sleep and he jackknifes in bed beside her, a gasping scream echoing between the empty walls of their bedroom, his still too thin chest heaving with the force of it, she will wrap her arms around his trembling form, unafraid of the way he startles within her grasp, his body growing tense like a string about to snap.  And she will hold him, whispering softly to him until that snap-ready tension begins to leach away, until the awful blackness in the unseeing pools of his eyes fades and he blinks, slowly, laboriously, coming back into the present.  Until he crumples, sagging bonelessly into her embrace.  And she will hold him, as tight as she dares, as he trembles against her, his body wracked by silent agonizing sobs.  Hold him until he falls back into the exhausted sleep, his face still tucked against the side of her neck.  And only then will she notice that she is crying, too, her own tears making new tracks on her skin where his have just begun to dry.  And she will wonder, as she watches his uneasy repose, her own sleep now refusing to come, if he will ever truly come back to her, if part of him will be forever lost somewhere amid that cold macabre beauty of space.

But for now as she watches him settle trustingly in her arms, watches his chest rise and fall at a steady reassuring rhythm, she thinks back to Rocket’s anguished reproach and she selfishly finds herself agreeing with the raccoon.

FIN

Chapter 4

–“I love you, I’m lucky.”–

 

She sits cross-legged on the floor of the space pod behind the backs of the crew seats, propped uncomfortably against the bulkhead.  Tries not to think about how alluring, how prohibitively soft and cozy they appear from her current position. It’s pointless to indulge in such thoughts – she won’t be moving from where she is now any time soon.  Because where she is now is the only place wide enough in this cramped little pod where she could sit down with Tony cradled securely in her armored embrace, and she is not about to allow herself to be parted from him. Not after everything. Not anymore.

She had retracted the armor the moment they settled down, gently tightening her hold on Tony when his unconscious form slipped further into her embrace once the additional bulk of the armor was gone.  She needed to touch him, to feel him solid and alive against her skin.  But he feels so cold, so cold.  

She hoists him up higher in her lap, trying to be as gentle as she possibly can, terrified that she would hurt him, would break him somehow.  Because he looks so fragile, so thin – ethereal almost, like he could disappear at any moment, could crumble to stardust in her arms.  

The thought makes her shiver, and she cocoons her body around him as if to shield him from the universe itself, to give him as much of her warmth as she can, ignoring the way her back twinges in protest.  

He still feels cold.

–“…lucky.”–

She thought they were too late.  When they stepped inside that spaceship – that cold, airless tomb, a black void of death amidst the apathetic, starry beauty of the cosmos, she thought they were too late.

And then she saw him – ghostly pale and lifeless, slumped ragdoll-like against a blue-skinned one-eyed woman, and she became convinced that they were.

But then the woman moved, sensing their approach, shifted as though to protect him, and a new rush of hope made Pepper’s knees go weak.

“His oxygen is almost out,” the woman rasped, when Pepper dropped down beside him, retracting her gauntlets and helmet despite the urgent flash of warning on the HUD.  

She could handle a few moments without oxygen.  She wanted to see with her own eyes the feeble rise and fall of his chest.  She wanted to touch his face.   She wanted… she needed… she…

“You need to hurry.”

Yes, that.

 

Gingerly she slipped her arms under Tony, pulling him in, pulling him up with her.  Moved to rush back toward the pod.

“My team?” Rocket’s sudden, desperation tinged growl stopped her in her tracks.

Oh no…

 

She watched the woman stumble weakly to her feet, one hand braced on the bulkhead.  Watched her shake her head with an expression of muted regret. “Dust,” she said, her voice as hollow as the look in her eye.  Then her expression twisted, morphing into something uglier, something deadly.  “Except Gamora.  He killed Gamora.”

The raccoon stiffened, eyes wide, mouth opening and closing in quick, convulsive bursts. And then sound burst through – an awful keening noise that echoed through the empty bowels of the ship like a death knell, making the darkness slither in closer, its icy breath seeming to filter past the suit’s defenses, making her shiver.

“Rocket,” she begged, forcing herself not to flinch away from him as he turned his grief-blackened eyes toward her, his little body trembling with the force of emotions that she understood all too well.  “Please, we gotta go. Let’s go.”

“We need to get the Terran home,” the blue-skinned woman broke in, impassive, startling them both, and Pepper watched in growing apprehension as the woman staggered a few steps to the nearby console to pick up an all-too-familiar helmet before addressing them both again in the same robotic tone. “He’s key to bringing everyone else back.”

Something about her words, something about the way she said it made Pepper tug Tony even closer to her chest, fighting the urge to run away from them both.

Rocket’s gaze snapped to her then, drawn by her involuntary movement, black eyes narrowing on Tony’s limp form cocooned in her armored grasp, the furry face twisting into an ugly resentful sneer.  “Lucky you,” he spat out, raising his gaze toward her.  “Lucky you.”  

–“…lucky.”–

She feels a shudder run through him, his gaunt chest spasming as if he’s suddenly running out of air, and she checks the gauge frantically, checks his mask.  But it’s not that, it’s not that.  And when she sees the way his eyes move behind closed lids, the way his face twists even in the unconsciousness that passes for sleep, she understands.

Carefully, she unwraps one arm from around his chest, moves it to run gentle fingers through his hair, matted with sweat and dried blood.

“Hush,” she shushes him, leaning in to place a quick kiss on the too-too cold skin of his brow. Ghosts her fingertips over the haggard hollow of his cheek.  “You’re safe now, you’ll be okay.  It’ll all be okay.”

She keeps up her mantra, whispering the soothing empty promises in his ear until he calms, the lines of his face softening, smoothing out, his breathing relaxing once more.  She lets herself relax, too, then.  Lets her forehead thump lightly against his, exhaling a soft sigh of relief, and almost allows herself to believe her own words.

Later, when they are back on Earth, she will sit at his bedside in the partially restored medical wing, watching him slowly get stronger, and she will think about the message he left her when he feared that he would never see her again, will think about how close that fear came to be, how close she came to losing him this time, how she might lose him still when all is said and done, when he gets strong enough to do what everyone expects of him to make things right.  

Later, when they are back at home, and a nightmare rips him out of his uneasy sleep and he jackknifes in bed beside her, a gasping scream echoing between the empty walls of their bedroom, his still too thin chest heaving with the force of it, she will wrap her arms around his trembling form, unafraid of the way he startles within her grasp, his body growing tense like a string about to snap.  And she will hold him, whispering softly to him until that snap-ready tension begins to leach away, until the awful blackness in the unseeing pools of his eyes fades and he blinks, slowly, laboriously, coming back into the present.  Until he crumples, sagging bonelessly into her embrace.  And she will hold him, as tight as she dares, as he trembles against her, his body wracked by silent agonizing sobs.  Hold him until he falls back into the exhausted sleep, his face still tucked against the side of her neck.  And only then will she notice that she is crying, too, her own tears making new tracks on her skin where his have just begun to dry.  And she will wonder, as she watches his uneasy repose, her own sleep now refusing to come, if he will ever truly come back to her, if part of him will be forever lost somewhere amid that cold macabre beauty of space.

But for now as she watches him settle trustingly in her arms, watches his chest rise and fall at a steady reassuring rhythm, she thinks back to Rocket’s anguished reproach and she selfishly finds herself agreeing with the raccoon.

“I love you,” she whispers, pressing another gentle kiss over the fading scar on his cheek.  “I’m lucky.”

FIN
trail.content_abstract:
Links to part 1 (masterlist), part 3

This is it for this story. There’s a kind of a time jump thing that this chapter does, I hope it makes sense.  Not sure I’m happy with the way it turned out but… well, I’ll let you, guys, decide about its merits.

summary: You’ve heard of Avengers 4 opening with Tony and Nebula returning to Earth blasting Queen’s Another One Bites the Dust, now get...
body:
You’ve heard of Avengers 4 opening with Tony and Nebula returning to Earth blasting Queen’s Another One Bites the Dust, now get ready for:

Avengers 4 opening with Tony recording the message to Pepper, lost in space, with Elton John’s Rocketman playing softly in the background.

“I miss the Earth so much. I miss my wife. It’s lonely out in space, on such a timeless flight…I’m not the man they think at home, oh no no no. I’m a rocket man. Rocket man, burning out his fuse up here alone.”

Y/N, a plus size artist from Malibu, isn’t expecting much to happen at her Uncle Phil’s retirement party. What she never expected was for her cousin Daisy to introduce her to the tallest, most beautiful man she’s ever seen. Or that he’d want to spend any time with her at all, let alone date her.

title: Half Agony, Half Hope
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2CzdUU8

by stellahibernis

When their family’s financial situation forces them to let out their house and move to the city, Bucky knows keeping up the isolation he has cultivated since he retired from the Strike Force with only disillusionment and a metal arm to show for it will become all but impossible. It starts with him escorting his sister around, but later he reconnects with some old friends, and starts to think that maybe he should really do something with his interest in sciences.

He’s intrigued by the Avengers, especially the man called Captain America, with whom he has a tenuous connection. He also finds out that his old friend Steve, who he hasn’t heard of in ten years, is somehow connected with Tony Stark. If he just wanted to, Bucky could make contact with him and try to repair their relationship.

Problem is, Bucky isn’t the same man he used to be when he last spoke with Steve, and he’s not sure if the chasm between them can be bridged anymore. In addition, the biggest surprise of his life is waiting for Bucky, requiring him to rethink everything.
